ViewDef.Title: Report: Distributed Port Groups for CSV export
ViewDef.Description:
A simple table for export as a CSV file. Used in report only, hence it has no formatting. Just like the rest of the report, it is designed for weekly, not daily nor monthly.
Schedule it to run end of the week, such as Sunday 23:59

ViewDef.Title: Report: Distributed Switch for CSV export
ViewDef.Description:
A simple table for export as a CSV file. Used in report only, hence it has no formatting. Just like the rest of the report, it is designed for weekly, not daily nor monthly.
Schedule it to run end of the week, such as Sunday 23:59

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Cluster distribution by VM count
ViewDef.Description: Relative distribution of clusters by the number of VMs. Pay attention to the extreme. Tailor the buckets to your environment.

ViewDef.Title: Report: Datastore for CSV export
ViewDef.Description:
A simple table for export as a CSV file. Used in report only, hence it has no formatting. Just like the rest of the report, it is designed for weekly, not daily nor monthly.
Schedule it to run end of the week, such as Sunday 23:59

ViewDef.Title: Windows CPU Usage
ViewDef.Description: List of individual CPU in a Windows-based operating system, as reported by Telegraf agent. Used in dashboard:Microsoft Windows

ViewDef.Title: Linux Operating Systems
ViewDef.Description: List of Linux virtual machines and physical machines, as reported by Telegraf agent. Host without Telegraf agent does not appear here. Used in dashboard:Linux

ViewDef.Title: Windows Operating Systems
ViewDef.Description: List of Microsoft Windows virtual machines and physical machines, as reported by Telegraf agent. Host without Telegraf agent does not appear here. Used in dashboard:Microsoft Windows

ViewDef.Title: VM Storage Configuration
ViewDef.Description:
List of VMs and their storage related configuration.
If you want to export to CSV, use the CSV report. All the CSV reports have many more columns as they are purpose built for export.

ViewDef.Title: Linux Disk Performance
ViewDef.Description: List of Linux OS disk and their disk IOPS and latency, as reported by Telegraf agent. Used in dashboard: Linux

ViewDef.Title: Report: Virtual Machines for CSV export
ViewDef.Description:
A simple table for export as a CSV file. Used in report only, hence it has no formatting. Just like the rest of the report, it is designed for weekly, not daily nor monthly.
Schedule it to run end of the week, such as Sunday 23:59

ViewDef.Title: Linux Disk Partition Usage
ViewDef.Description: List of Linux OS disk partition and their disk space utilization, as reported by Telegraf agent. Used in dashboard: Linux

ViewDef.Title: ESXi Security Policy List
ViewDef.Description: List of ESXi services and their status. Ensure this matches security best practices and your expectation for the host

ViewDef.Title: VM Configuration
ViewDef.Description:
List of VMs and their key configuration. It's also created for export to spreadsheet.
Shares, Limit and Reservation are not shown as they need to be seen in the context of a cluster and resource pool. They are covered in the Resource Management dashboard.
The properties exclude storage, as there is a separate dashboard for storage related configuraiton.

ViewDef.Title: Report: Namespace for CSV export
ViewDef.Description: Lists the key configurations of a Namespace.

ViewDef.Title: ESXi Configuration List
ViewDef.Description: Displays the aggregated data about the different ESXI configuration of the host systems in your environment.

ViewDef.Title: ESXi Storage Adapters
ViewDef.Description: List of HBA (host based adapter) and their driver type. Ensure this matches best practices and the expected setting for the adapter.

ViewDef.Title: Report: vCenter for CSV Export
ViewDef.Description:
A simple table for export as a CSV file. Used in report only, hence it has no formatting. Just like the rest of the report, it is designed for weekly, not daily nor monthly.
Schedule it to run end of the week, such as Sunday 23:59

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Switch Version
ViewDef.Description: Absolute distribution of outdated vSphere distributed Switch. Keep the version consistent with your vSphere.

ViewDef.Title: ESXi BIOS version distribution
ViewDef.Description: Relative shares of ESXi BIOS version. Ensure they match your expectation, ESXi compatibility and vendor best practices

ViewDef.Title: VM Memory Limit
ViewDef.Description: Count of VMs with memory limit. Limit results in unpredictable performance problem, especially those with low threshold. Limit also incurs operational overhead to manage.

ViewDef.Title: Report: vSphere Pod for CSV export
ViewDef.Description:
A simple table for export as a CSV file. Used in report only, hence it has no formatting. Just like the rest of the report, it is designed for weekly, not daily nor monthly.
Schedule it to run end of the week, such as Sunday 23:59

ViewDef.Title: VM with Hot Add Memory
ViewDef.Description: Count of VMs with hot add CPU enabled. While dynamic configuration is a powerful feature, it increases complexity in capacity and performance management.

ViewDef.Title: Guest OS Distribution
ViewDef.Description: Relative distribution of Guest Operating system. Keep the number of variations minimal, as they complicate operations.

ViewDef.Title: ESXi vMotion Status
ViewDef.Description: Count of ESXi hosts with vMotion deactivated.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Cluster DRS Automation Level
ViewDef.Description: DRS Automation level. Ensure it matches the purpose of the cluster and DRS best practices.

ViewDef.Title: ESXi CPU Core Distribution
ViewDef.Description: Absolute distribution of ESXi hosts, by their CPU size in GHz. Keep them minimal. Also, pay attention to small hosts as they have relatively higher overhead, hence less optimized. To change the threshold, go to filter tab.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Port Group MAC Address
ViewDef.Description: Count of distributed port group that allows network MAC address to be changed. Minimize this as it allows MAC address impersonation. If allowed, ESXi host does not drop the packet when the Guest OS MAC address does not match the VM MAC address.

ViewDef.Title: Report: vSphere Clusters for CSV Export
ViewDef.Description:
A simple table for export as a CSV file. Used in report only, hence it has no formatting. Just like the rest of the report, it is designed for weekly, not daily nor monthly.
Schedule it to run end of the week, such as Sunday 23:59

Property.name: displayName
Property.value: Reclaimable Disk Space from Powered Off VM

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Clusters distribution by ESXi count
ViewDef.Description: Absolute distribution of clusters by the number of ESXi hosts. Keep the total number of variants minimal for ease of operations. Take note of small clusters, as they have relatively higher overhead, hence less optimized.

ViewDef.Title: VM Capacity Consumption
ViewDef.Description: List of VM and their footprint on the cluster. Used in cluster capacity analysis to figure out which VMs have largest reservation and utilization. Both the VM CPU and memory are shown.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Clusters by datastores count
ViewDef.Description: Absolute distribution of vSphere clusters by their count of connected datastores. For ease of operations, minimize the number of sharing among clusters.

ViewDef.Title: Report: Supervisor Cluster for CSV export
ViewDef.Description: Supervisor Cluster Configuration Summary.

ViewDef.Title: Report: vSphere Data Center for CSV export
ViewDef.Description:
A simple table for export as a CSV file. Used in report only, hence it has no formatting. Just like the rest of the report, it is designed for weekly, not daily nor monthly.
Schedule it to run end of the week, such as Sunday 23:59

ViewDef.Title: ESXi Cluster Settings
ViewDef.Description: Lists the summary of the ESXi configuration for different host systems in your environment, focusing on settings that should be identical within a cluster.

ViewDef.Title: Windows Disk Partition Usage
ViewDef.Description: List of Microsoft Windows disk partition and their disk space utilization, as reported by Telegraf agent. Used in dashboard:Microsoft Windows

ViewDef.Title: Linux CPU Usage
ViewDef.Description: List of individual CPU in a Linux-based operating system, as reported by Telegraf agent. Used in dashboard:Linux

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Port Group Promiscuous Mode
ViewDef.Description: Count of distributed port groups that allow promiscuous mode. Minimize this for security reason, and only use for the use case it's designed for.

ViewDef.Title: VM Snapshots List
ViewDef.Description: Lists the summary of the Snapshots size and days for VM in your environment.

ViewDef.Title: Report: ESXi Hosts for CSV Export
ViewDef.Description:
A simple table for export as a CSV file. Used in report only, hence it has no formatting. Just like the rest of the report, it is designed for weekly, not daily nor monthly.
Schedule it to run end of the week, such as Sunday 23:59

ViewDef.Title: VM Virtual Disks
ViewDef.Description: List of virtual machine disks and their inventory information

ViewDef.Title: Windows Network Adapter
ViewDef.Description: List of each network adapter utilization as reported by Telegraf agent. Used in dashboard:Microsoft Windows

ViewDef.Title: ESXi Hardware Model
ViewDef.Description: Relative distribution of server hardware. Keep the number of variations minimal, as they complicate operations. Having a standard can also increase in lower cost from higher negotiation.

ViewDef.Title: VM Distribution by Time Remaining
ViewDef.Description: Count of VMs, grouped by the capacity remaining. The view is color coded for quick analysis

ViewDef.Title: VM CPU Utilization
ViewDef.Description: Trend line of CPU utilization of a VM. As the context is Guest OS capacity, the primary metric is CPU Net Run. CPU Usage is shown as it's what almost all customers are accustomed to.

ViewDef.Title: VM Network Configuration
ViewDef.Description: Lists the network configuration of a VM for the selected Network Switch in your environment.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Resource Pool List
ViewDef.Description: List of resource pools. Pay attention to resource pool with limit, shares and reservation.

ViewDef.Title: Guest OS from vCenter
ViewDef.Description:
Displays the guest operating system name as shown in the vCenter UI. Compare this with the name from vCenter UI. Notes the 2 names may not be identical.
Keep the number of variations minimal, as they complicate operations.

Property.name: localizedAttributeName
Property.value: Summary|Guest Operating System|Guest OS from Tools

ViewDef.Title: VM Distribution by Disk Size
ViewDef.Description: Absolute distribution VM configured disk space. Minimize the large VMs, especially those nearing the size of the datastore, as they can create capacity problem. It will also take longer to storage vMotion and back up.

ViewDef.Title: Guest OS from Tools
ViewDef.Description: Displays the guest operating system name as reported by Tools. Compare this with the name from vCenter UI. Notes the 2 names may not be identical.

ViewDef.Title: VM CPU Limit
ViewDef.Description: Count of VMs with CPU Limit. CPU Limit results in unpredictable performance problem, especially those with low threshold.
